title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 13 May 2013 - XWiki

10:46 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:59 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
11:35 <sburjan> tmortagne, ping\  
11:41 <vmassol> good morning everyone  
11:41 <sburjan> hello vmassol  
11:46 <tmortagne> sburjan: pong  
11:46 <sburjan> tmortagne, I am testing an upgrade from 4.5.3 to 5.0.1, and I am at step 3  
11:47 <sburjan> and at step 3, I am getting: http://imgbin.org/index.php?page=image&id=13477  
11:48 <sburjan> at the top, for the ui-all section. is it normal to import ui-all ?  
11:48 <sburjan> I knew that DW does not use ui-all  
11:53 <mflorea> has quit  
11:55 <tmortagne> sburjan: it depends  
11:55 <tmortagne> what upgrade mode did you choose ?  
11:55 <sburjan> All wikis  
11:55 <sburjan> so the sorinello wiki and workspacetemplate wiki  
11:56 <tmortagne> then it's just telling you that you have subwikis with the extension XE UI All in it and that you should upgrade it  
11:56 <sburjan> this is why they are listed twice there. That makes sense let's say  
11:56 <tmortagne> so yes it's normal  
11:56 <sburjan> yes, but is it correct to have ui-all installed ?  
11:56 <tmortagne> it's not listed twice  
11:56 <tmortagne> this step layout is one section per wiki  
11:57 <tmortagne> you can see your wiki name above each extension listed  
11:57 <tmortagne> sburjan: that's the extension you have installed  
11:57 <tmortagne> this step is not dealing with defult UIs  
11:57 <sburjan> yes  
11:57 <tmortagne> it's dealing with extensions  
11:57 <tmortagne> so it's suggesting you a new version of your extension  
11:58 <sburjan> the "UI-all" part was confusing. I was expecting to see only "UI"  
11:58 <sburjan> thanks  
11:58 <tmortagne> sure but you have UI-all installed  
11:58 <tmortagne> this step is not trying to be cleaver right now it's just upgrading what you have  
11:59 <sburjan> ok, I see  
12:01 <alexch> has joined #xwiki  
12:07 <sburjan> tmortagne, DW migration was ok to 5.0.1. So the "All wikis" option works  
12:07 <tmortagne> sburjan: ok cool  
12:46 <alexch> has quit

14:33 <silviar> has joined #xwiki  
14:33 <jbwiv1> is now known as <jbwiv>  
14:33 <jbwiv> morning all. I'd like to prompt my users for user input for one field, connect to a database external to xwiki, and then display formatted results. I see there is a plugin to execute sql from xwiki, so does this sound possible? If so, how can I avoid storing the password to the database in the source?
